headline: Lithium Americas Rockets After Hours
summary: Shares in Lithium Americas surged 70% after hours Tuesday, following a Reuters report that the U.S. is negotiating a stake as large as 10% in the Canadian mining company.  The investment would be the latest move by the Trump administration to leverage loans made under the Biden administration into a stake in a company, as it did most famously with Intel, in the name of building U.S. manufacturing capacity.  Lithium Americas is developing a Nevada lithium mine called Thacker Pass along with General Motors, with the help of a $2.26 billion Energy Department loan from last year.

raw.headline: Lithium Americas Rockets After Hours
raw.summary: Shares in Lithium Americas surged 70% after hours Tuesday, following a Reuters report that the U.S. is negotiating a stake as large as 10% in the Canadian mining company.  The investment would be the latest move by the Trump administration to leverage loans made under the Biden administration into a stake in a company, as it did most famously with Intel, in the name of building U.S. manufacturing capacity.  Lithium Americas is developing a Nevada lithium mine called Thacker Pass along with General Motors, with the help of a $2.26 billion Energy Department loan from last year.

headline: Exclusive-Trump administration seeks equity stake in Lithium Americas amid loan talks
summary: (Reuters) -The Trump administration is seeking an equity stake of as much as 10% in Lithium Americas as it renegotiates terms of the company's $2.26 billion Energy Department loan for its Thacker Pass lithium project with General Motors, two people familiar with the discussions told Reuters.  The proposed stake is the latest example of the Trump administration intervening directly in the American economy as it has in taking stakes in Intel, MP Materials and other U.S. tech and minerals firms to promote industries it sees as critical to national security.  Slated to become the Western Hemisphere's largest source of lithium when it opens in 2028, the Thacker Pass mine has been under construction for nearly a year with more than 600 contractors at the site roughly 25 miles (40 km) south of Nevada's border with Oregon.

The proposed stake is the latest example of the Trump administration intervening directly in the American economy as it has in taking stakes in Intel, MP Materials and other U.S. tech and minerals firms to promote industries it sees as critical to national security.  Slated to become the Western Hemisphere's largest source of lithium when it opens in 2028, the Thacker Pass mine has been under construction for nearly a year with more than 600 contractors at the site roughly 25 miles (40 km) south of Nevada's border with Oregon.

headline: Nvidia-OpenAI: What Wall Street thinks about the $100B AI deal
summary: Semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA) will be investing $100 billion in OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). This news comes just after Nvidia announced a $5 billion stake in Intel (INTC) alongside a new data center partnership. Robinhood Chief Investment Officer Stephanie Guild and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma gauge Wall Street's reaction to these Nvidia headlines and what it means for the chipmaker's valuation as it contributes to building out artificial intelligence infrastructure. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Nvidia Stock Slips From Record High. OpenAI Deal Raises These Questions.
summary: Nvidia’s $100 billion OpenAI deal has been cheered by investors and analysts alike.  Nvidia shares slid 1.3% to $181.11 in early trading Tuesday after the stock hit a record closing high of $183.61, up 3.9% on the day.  As part of the agreement, OpenAI would deploy some 10 gigawatts of AI data centers using Nvidia systems, including millions of its graphic processing units (GPUs) and other products.

headline: Intel's Nvidia deal doesn't 'move the needle,' Intel bear says
summary: Intel (INTC) stock surged last week on news of the company's partnership with Nvidia (NVDA), but Citi head of US semiconductor research Christopher Danely is unconvinced that Intel teaming up with the dominant artificial intelligence (AI) chipmaker will translate to meaningful earnings growth. headline: Could Rising Intel Investment Spur a New Demand Cycle for KLA (KLAC) Equipment?
summary: Recent industry developments saw Nvidia announce a US$5 billion investment in Intel, with both companies collaborating on innovative products, and SoftBank following with a US$2 billion investment in Intel, fueling heightened optimism across the U.S. semiconductor industry. Although KLA was not directly involved in these transactions, the increased capital flowing to major chipmakers like Intel may indirectly benefit KLA by driving expectations for higher demand in semiconductor equipment...

headline: Factbox-Companies pouring billions to advance AI infrastructure
summary: Nvidia will invest $5 billion in Intel, giving it roughly 4% of the company after new shares are issued.  Oracle is in talks with Meta for a multi-year cloud computing deal worth about $20 billion, underscoring the social media giant's drive to secure faster access to computing power.  CoreWeave signed a $6.3 billion initial order with backer Nvidia, a deal that guarantees that the AI chipmaker will purchase any cloud capacity not sold to customers.

headline: Nvidia Has a Problem: Too Much Money
summary: Nvidia  has a problem most of its competitors would kill to have: The AI-chip giant has too much money.  Nvidia has made big headlines over the past few days not for all the chips that it sells, but for the big checks it can write.  The company said late last week it is investing $5 billion into beleaguered chip manufacturer  Intel  Then came news Monday of a plan for Nvidia to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI over an unspecified period that will likely span at least a few years.
